intro: Balsamiflua ariana, commonly known as the Armenian balsam, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a sticky, balsamic resin, which gives it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
